item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
https://remapradio.com/articles/this-week-at-remap-60/

Send good vibes, friends. My wife is out of town for the next week, which means ol' Patrick is solo parenting until her return. But it does mean my evenings are free once the children are in bed, which will result in an indulgent mixture of beer, shotgunning the third season of Daredevil ahead of the new season, and maybe—just maybe—finally rewatching Interstellar. I've been worried about watching Interstellar because it moved me at the time of release, long before I had kids. I expect to turn into a pile of dust and tears if I'm brave enough to revisit that one.

-pk, who expects most of his time will be taken by Avowed

  • PODCAST: HOA – We start by sharing a few thoughts on a dearly departed friend, my Costco hot tub, before life updates on paint, contractors, and more.
  • STREAM: Onimusha – Barring any fuckin' sliding block puzzles, there's a decent chance we're able to beat this game before the stream is over. That said, it would be incredibly good content if there was another sliding block puzzle.
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – [Patrick spends another hour praising Avowed, but worries the developers are putting too many spiders into the game]
  • STREAM: The Wheel of GeForce Now – Spin, wheel, spin! Not set in stone, but we've talked about playing this game as a group next week.
  • ARTICLE: Letter Series – Topic to be determined, as per usual.
  • STREAM: Volgarr the Viking x Nextlander – Could this be the finale?
  • OTHER ARTICLES: Rob wrote two things! Whoa!

If you have any support issues, send details on the issue to support@remapradio.com.

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
